result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander N Bussiere was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Pierce County Case 15CM24 Ct#1 and Ct#2

3:27  This includes 15CM82  Defendant Alexander N Bussiere in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Rory OSullivan  appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plead to Ct 1 & 2  15CM24  Ct 3 in 15CM80.  Dismiss the remaining counts in both cases.  3 years probation on each count conc. If successfully completes agreement case may be expunged. OSullivan will file amended complaints so 15CM24 will be 2 misdeneabir  battery and  15CM80 will be 1 ct disorderly conduct. Bond will be discharged after conviction  so the no contact will no longer apply .  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 1 and 2 of 15CM24    15CM80 Ct 1 defendant pleads guilty .   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 & 2 in 15CM24   15CM80  Defendant pleads guilty to Ct 1.  Amended complaints are filed in both cases.   Court orders on 15CM24   Ct 1 & 2 S/W Probation  3 years on each ct concurrent to each other. Conditions: Whateever conditions the agent imposes. Court costs    15CM80 Ct 1 S/W 1 year probation concurrent to the probation in 15CM24  Conditions Court costs. Condtiions as imposed by the agent. DNA sample and surcharge.  If the defendant successfully conpletes probation the cases will be expunged.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

3:28 Defendant Alexander N Bussiere in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Alexander N Bussiere in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and maximum penalties on the record.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. OSullivan: $2000 sign bond. Nelson pleas not guilty on behalf of Defendant.  Atty Melissa Petersen is counsel on other pending matters. Nelson has no objection to sign bond. Def has not been in the armed services.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
